abstract: HSBC has halted its discussions to buy a $7.3 billion controlling stake in the South African lender Nedbank, according to Old Mutual, the African insurer that owns 53 percent of shares in the bank.
snippet: HSBC has halted its discussions to buy a $7.3 billion controlling stake in the South African lender Nedbank, according to Old Mutual, the African insurer that owns 53 percent of shares in the bank.
lead_paragraph: HSBC, Europe’s largest bank, has halted its discussions to buy a $7.3 billion controlling stake in the South African lender Nedbank, according to a news release from Old Mutual, the African insurer that owns 53 percent of shares in the bank.

headline.main: HSBC Pulls Out of Bid for 70% of Nedbank
